titleStmt.title: TEI P5 version 3.7.0 and Stylesheets version 7.49.0 release notes

sourceDesc.p: created retrospectively from ChangeLog and GitHub trackers

body.p: Release 3.7.0, the “XXX” of the TEI Guidelines introduces new features and resolves a number of issues raised by the TEI community. As always, the majority of these changes and corrections are a consequence of feature requests or bugs reported by the TEI community using the GitHub tracking system. A full list of the issues resolved in the course of this release cycle may be found under the 3.7.0 milestone.

The following changes are particularly worth highlighting in this release:
The standOff element functions as a container element for linked data, contextual information, and stand-off annotations embedded in a TEI document (#374). In the course of this several chapters of the Guidelines have been revised:
Speeches and Speakers in Performance Texts
Default Text Structure
Names of Persons, Places, and Organizations in Manuscript Description
The Person Element, States, Traits, and Events, and Objects in Names, Dates, People, and Places
The standOff Container in Linking, Segmentation, and Alignment
With the introduction of the standOff element model.describedResource has been introduced and model.resource has been revised.
The elements decoNote, explicit, and incipit are now member of model.biblPart (#1784).
The description of the points attribute in att.coordinated has been clarified (#1789).
The xr has been made a member of att.typed (#1810).
Travis has been migrated to travis.com (#1826).
The description on manuscript description clarifies that msDesc can be used for all text-bearing objects (#1835).
The content model of repository, institution, and collection has been changed from macro.xtext to macro.phraseSeq.limited (#1836).
The g element is now available within the zone element (#1838).
The placeName element has been added to model.settingPart and the example in setting has been changed accordingly (#1842).
The dateline element is now a member of model.pLike.front and can therefor be used in the same way than the byline element (#1843).
The restriction for teidata.word has been changed (#1930).
Corrections of typographic errors, improvements on explanations, and corrections of examples have been conducted in various sections of the Guidelines (including #1964, #1965, #1968), #1954, #1952, #1948.
Furthermore, a number of translations have been added or updated. For the Japanese translations, we especially thank Kiyonori Nagasaki and his formidable team, along with Hanna McGaughey.

Documentation of Council practices in TCW 20 is improved for referencing figures more precisely and for more consistently writing Schematron constraints using standard Schematron values for the role attribute.
Corrections have been conducted in various sections of the TEI website (including #1944), #1938.

In addition, many improvements have been made to the XSLT stylesheets (which provide processing of TEI ODD files for Roma and OxGarage as well as other TEI conversions). The Stylesheets are maintained separately from the Guidelines and are at https://github.com/TEIC/Stylesheets. A full list of the issues resolved in the course of this release cycle may be found under the 7.49.0 milestone.

Highlights of this release include:
Correct handling of Schematron rules in attDef elements (#403).
The jquery library has been updated (#359).
